title: Kellogg's raises prices of popular breakfast cereals due to 'unprecedented drought conditions'
text:
Kellogg's blames devastating drought conditions trickling from farms to shelves as the reason for jacking up prices on its well-known breakfast cereals.

The cost of Australian-grown wheat, corn, oats and rice has surged as the biggest dry spell in over a century sweeps across the nation.

Popular brands affected include Corn Flakes, Coco pops, Nutri Grain, Froot Loops, All-Bran, Special K and Rice Bubbles.

Impacted brands include Corn Flakes, Coco pops, Nutri Grain, Froot Loops, All-Bran, Special K, Rice Bubbles will be affect as well as others (pictured)

'We know Aussie consumers are also feeling the pinch – so this is not a decision we have taken lightly,' A Kellogg's statement read.

'We've worked hard across the business to drive efficiencies and find opportunities to absorb as much of the increase as possible – including our recent announcement to invest in the Beryl Solar farm for our energy needs – but unfortunately we've not be able to offset all of the increased costs.

'As a result, we've made the tough decision to increase the list price for our cereals.'

The increase, in place since July, will see consumers wear the cost of the drought which began in mid 2017.

A string of country town across New South Wales - the worst struck region - are on the brink of running out of water.

According to the Bureau of Meteorology, rainfall in September was 'below' to 'very much below' average for most of Australia.

The news comes amid reports over recent months that regional populations are under threat as people relocate to cities for jobs and opportunities.
